intro: Chimaphila menziesii, commonly known as the flame azalea, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves that are dark green and glossy. Its showy, tubular flowers are typically pink or red, blooming in late spring to early summer. Chimaphila menziesii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens.
